messages.content: Write a scene from the show Curb Your Enthusiasm, where Larry is driving Leon home, while Leon insists on sitting in the back seat.

Larry: Hey, Leon, how are you doing?
Leon: I'm doing okay, I guess. I just wanted to thank you for helping me out, man. You're a real good friend.
Larry: Well, I'm happy to help. But you know, I don't want you to be uncomfortable or anything. You can sit in the front seat if you want.
Leon: Oh no, I don't want to be a bother. I'm just happy to be here.
Larry: Well, it's no bother at all. I don't mind. It's the least I can do.
Leon: Thanks, man. I really appreciate it.
Larry: No problem. Let's go.
Leon: Where are we headed?
Larry: Just a little detour. I have to drop by my house for a minute.
Leon: Oh, okay. I don't mind. I'm just happy to be here.
Larry: Alright. Let's go.
Leon: Hey, Larry, while we're on the topic of driving. I have to ask you something. How come you always drive so slow? It's like you're intentionally aggravating me.
Larry: Oh, come on, Leon. You know me. I'm just a laid-back kind of guy. I don't like to drive too fast.
Leon: Well, I don't get it. Why do you always have to drive so slow?
Larry: It's just my style. I like to keep things relaxed.
Leon: Well, I don't like it. I feel like I'm being dragged along, you know?
Larry: Well, I don't want you to feel that way. I'm just trying to make you comfortable.
Leon: Well, it's not working. I don't like it.
Larry: Okay, buddy. Fine. I'll drop you off at home and I'll go back to my own car.
Leon: No, no, no. No, no, no. I mean, I'm just going to sit in the back seat. I don't want you to drive me. I don't like it.
Larry: Alright, man. I understand. But I'm going to drop you off at home and I'll go back to my own car.
Leon: No, no, no. I don't want you to do that. I don
This is close, but they shouldn't discuss it first. Leon should just get in the back seat, and Larry should get annoyed and ask what he's doing.

Alright, let's try again.
Leon: Hey, Larry, where are we headed?
Larry: Hey, Leon. Thanks for asking. I'm going to drop by my house for a minute.
Leon: Oh, okay. I don't want you to do that. I don't like it.
Larry: I don't like it either. I just wanted to sit in the back seat.
Leon: No, no, no. I don't like it. I feel like I'm being dragged along.
Larry: Alright, fine. I'll drop you off at home and you can sit in the front seat.
Leon: No, I don't want to sit in the front seat. I want to sit in the back seat.
Larry: No, no, no. I don't like it. I feel like I'm being dragged along.
Leon: Alright, fine. I'll drop you off at home and you can sit in the front seat.
Larry: No, no, no. I don't want you to sit in the front seat. I'm not comfortable with that. I just want to sit in the back seat.
Leon: No, no, no. I don't like it. I feel like I'm being dragged along.
Larry: Alright, fine. I'll drop you off at home and you can sit in the front seat.
Leon: No, no, no. I don't want to sit in the front seat. I don't like it. I feel like I'm being dragged along.
Larry: Alright, fine. I'll drop you off at home and you can sit in the back seat.
Leon: No, no, no. I don't want to sit in the back seat. I don't like it. I feel like I'm being dragged along.
Larry: Alright, fine. I'll drop you off at home and you can sit in the front seat.
Leon: No, no, no. I don't want to sit in the front seat. I don't want to sit in the front seat. I don't like it. I feel like I'm being dragged along.
Larry: Alright, fine. I'll drop you off at home and you can sit in the back seat.
